item.title: Command help?
item.dc:creator: @hahaxxxaaaaa hahaxxxaaaaa
item.description:
@hahaxxxaaaaa wrote:

what c.sM is supposed to do is send the message within the parameters to the specified name. For example ::rskills chris should reset his stats and send him the message Your skills have been reset, whereas just sM would send the person using the command that text.

Read full topic

item.title: Command help?
item.dc:creator: @mod_cody mod cody
item.description:
@mod_cody wrote:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("rskills") && playerRights >= 1) {
  String name = command.substring(8);
  client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)];
for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
setSkillLevel(i, playerLevel[1], playerXP[0]);
}
refreshSkills();
sM("Your stats have been reset");
}

this should work now that i know ur using delta

item.title: Command help?
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

Your command length is 7, and your substring catch is also 7? To make that work you’d have to put the command immediately followed by the player’s name (IE ::rskillsPlayerName).

Set your substring line to look like this.

String name = command.substring(8);

Read full topic

try this…

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("rskills") && playerRights >= 1) { String name = command.substring(7); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) { c.setSkillLevel(i, playerLevel[1], playerXP[0]); } c.refreshSkills(); c.sM("Your stats have been reset"); }

item.title: Command help?
item.dc:creator: @hahaxxxaaaaa hahaxxxaaaaa
item.description:
@hahaxxxaaaaa wrote:

I’ve been trying to make a skill reset command but I honestly do not know what is wrong with the java within it. I’m not a hardcore java dev and I’ve been learning snippets of Java here and there since I’ve been dicking around with private servers, a little help would be appreciated. Btw when it compiles there are no errors, yet when I execute the command the player’s skills are not reset to 99 and they do not receive the message. The syntax is as follows: ::rskills Thank you.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("rskills") && playerRights >= 1) { String name = command.substring(7); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) { c.setSkillLevel(i, playerLevel[99], playerXP[14000000]); } c.refreshSkills(); c.sM("Your stats have been reset"); }

Read full topic
